ace_hearts.title: Buyback & Burn
ace_hearts.description: Tokens are burnt as the protocol generates revenue, thereby reducing its supply and increasing the unit value.

two_hearts.title: Compensation
two_hearts.description: Payment or reward provided in exchange for work.

three_hearts.title: Multiple Funding Sources
three_hearts.description: Receiving financial support from two or more entities.

four_hearts.title: Time-based Boost
four_hearts.description: Accumulate boosts over time which award them more rewards and/or governance rights. Holders can unstake anytime but then lose their boost.

five_hearts.title: Token Inflation
five_hearts.description: Issuing new supply of a token to incentivize a particular set of behaviors.

six_hearts.title: Peer Audit
six_hearts.description: A security evaluation by an actor with similar competencies as the producer.

seven_hearts.title: Mutual Insurance
seven_hearts.description: A cooperative insurance model where members pool resources to provide coverage against losses.

eight_hearts.title: Liquidity Mining
eight_hearts.description: Rewarding users who provide liquidity to particular token pools.

nine_hearts.title: Vesting
nine_hearts.description: A mechanism that gradually releases tokens or other assets over time.

ten_hearts.title: Bounty
ten_hearts.description: A pre-specified task and reward for anyone who completes a specific task or achieving within a particular ecosystem.

jack_hearts.title: Patronage-based Earnings
jack_hearts.description: A mechanism where token holders earn rewards in proportion to their usage of a platform or provision of service to the platform.

queen_hearts.title: Token Stream
queen_hearts.description: Continuous transfer of tokens from a sender's account to a receiver's account. The sender's account balance decreases at a specific rate per second, while the receiver's account balance increases at the same rate.

king_hearts.title: Penalties
king_hearts.description: Punishments imposed for breaking the rules.

ace_diamonds.title: Instant Governance
ace_diamonds.description: Token-holders stake on values for each governance parameter and the resulting value is adjusted in real-time based on the stake-weighted median.

two_diamonds.title: Pass/Fail Voting
two_diamonds.description: A simple binary voting system where participants can only choose between "yes" or "no".

three_diamonds.title: Approval Voting
three_diamonds.description: A voting mechanism where voters can select more than one option and the option with the most approvals wins.

four_diamonds.title: Wait for Quiet Voting
four_diamonds.description: Wait until voting has quieted down before closing a vote.

five_diamonds.title: Single Choice Voting
five_diamonds.description: A simple voting system in which participants choose one option from a list of choices.

six_diamonds.title: Pairwise Voting
six_diamonds.description: A budgeting process where options are presented in pairs, and participants choose their preferred option from each pair. The formula distributes funding by computing the preferences over all pairwise comparisons.

seven_diamonds.title: Random Jury Arbitration
seven_diamonds.description: A process where a randomly selected group of individuals make a decision on a dispute or issue.

eight_diamonds.title: Resistance Voting
eight_diamonds.description: Proposals default to passing unless there is enough resistance. Participants vote against the options they dislike, rather than for the options they prefer.

nine_diamonds.title: Osmotic Funding
nine_diamonds.description: The rate at which each project is funded is determined by the staked amount and the available funds. The rate variations are smoothed over time to avoid high rate variations and offer stability to the projects.

ten_diamonds.title: Holographic Consensus
ten_diamonds.description: A governance mechanism that allows for local decisions that represent the interests of a global group.

jack_diamonds.title: Rank-choice Voting
jack_diamonds.description: A voting system where participants rank the available options in order of preference.

queen_diamonds.title: Conviction Voting
queen_diamonds.description: Proposals are passed based on aggregated continuous preferences of community members. A member can change their preference at any time, but the longer they keep their preference for the same proposal, the “stronger” their conviction gets. This added conviction gives long-standing community members with consistent preferences more influence than short-term participants merely trying to influence a vote.

king_diamonds.title: Quadratic Voting
king_diamonds.description: A voting mechanism where participants can allocate a limited number of voting "points" to different options, with the number of points allocated being proportional to the square root of the number of points.

ace_clubs.title: Decentralized ID
ace_clubs.description: Unique identifiers that allow entities to be identified in a verifiable and persistent way without relying on a centralized registry. DIDs form the basis for self-sovereign identity (SSI), a decentralized digital identity model that gives individuals control over their own identity information.

two_clubs.title: Mutual Credit
two_clubs.description: Credit that members can issue to each other based on mutual trust, rather than using traditional forms of collateral.

three_clubs.title: Time-bound Funding
three_clubs.description: Participants submit proposals within a fixed time period for a fixed amount of capital, which is distributed among top winners based on the voting outcome.

four_clubs.title: Verifiable Credential
four_clubs.description: A digital credential that can be used to verify the identity or qualifications of an individual or organization.

five_clubs.title: Soulbound Token
five_clubs.description: A token that represents a user's reputation or standing within a community, and cannot be transferred.

six_clubs.title: Batched Auction
six_clubs.description: Consensus mechanism that groups individual proposals together and executes them simultaneously. All proposals within a batch are settled at the same uniform clearing parameters.

seven_clubs.title: Quorum
seven_clubs.description: The Minimum level of participation required for a decision to be valid.

eight_clubs.title: Token Gate
eight_clubs.description: Restricting access to certain services, features or content based on token holdings. Additional constraints can also be included, such as the amount of time a token has been held.

nine_clubs.title: Social Graph
nine_clubs.description: A graphical representation of individuals and their relationships.

ten_clubs.title: Souldbound NFT
ten_clubs.description: A non-transferable, non-fungible token (NFT), typically used to represent a digital badge or achievement within a particular ecosystem.

jack_clubs.title: Oversight
jack_clubs.description: Supervision of a process, operation, or work, to ensure it is being done correctly and adheres to the rules.

queen_clubs.title: Oracle
queen_clubs.description: An information source that provides external data to smart contracts.

king_clubs.title: Time-delay Execution
king_clubs.description: A mechanism that imposes a delay on certain actions to prevent spam, fraud or attacks.

ace_spades.title: Fair Ranking
ace_spades.description: An economic system for curating information with no single point of failure and no owner, where information which ranks highly is provably valuable to network stakeholders, while protecting against the rich. Whoever stakes the most tokens ranks highest, but the more tokens you stake, the cheaper it is to downvote you.

two_spades.title: NFT Drop
two_spades.description: A method of distributing non-fungible tokens (NFTs) through a random or selective process.

three_spades.title: ve(3,3) Tokenomics
three_spades.description: Variation of the veToken model that provides dilution protection and flexibility to token lockers. This resolves the capital inefficiency and liquidity concerns associated with ve assets.

four_spades.title: Merkle Airdrop
four_spades.description: A distribution mechanism where tokens are given away for free to a specific group of people or randomly to anyone who meets certain criteria. Merkle Drops use a cryptographic technique to verify eligibility and allow users to claim their own allocation from the contract.

five_spades.title: Delegation
five_spades.description: Assigning voting rights to another address, allowing the other address to vote on the holders behalf. Vote delegation can be topic-specific, where an address can delegate its voting rights on different types of decisions to different addresses.

six_spades.title: Prediction Markets
six_spades.description: Allows users to trade on future event outcomes. Participants stake tokens on their predictions, and markets are resolved when event outcomes are verified.

seven_spades.title: Universal Basic Income
seven_spades.description: Provides all participants in a network with a basic income.

eight_spades.title: Blind Bid, Second Price
eight_spades.description: An auction where bids are submitted privately, and the winner receives the amount of the second highest bid.

nine_spades.title: Reverse Dutch Auction
nine_spades.description: An auction where the price of an asset starts high and gradually decreases over time.

ten_spades.title: Vote Decay
ten_spades.description: Voting power decays over time according to certain conditions, like if the holder does not vote.

jack_spades.title: Quadratic Funding
jack_spades.description: A donation-matching scheme that prioritizes projects based on the number of people who contributed rather than just the amount contributed. The share of the matching pool that each project receives is based on the square root of each contribution. This reduces the power of large donors to influence the matching of funds.

queen_spades.title: Secret Ballot
queen_spades.description: A form of voting that allows participants to keep their votes private, providing a layer of anonymity.

king_spades.title: Futarchy
king_spades.description: A governance mechanism where decisions are made based on the outcome of prediction markets.
